intro: Phyllanthus leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in lowland forests. It has a compact growth habit and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
